definition: to draw back the corners of one's mouth
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs

sentences.english: His face twisted in a grin.
As she told me about her newly improved cooking skills, Cody grinned.
sentences.chinese: 當她告訴我最近她廚藝大漲的時候，科迪咧嘴一笑。

sentences.english: The driver grinned and gave me a thumbs-up sign.
sentences.chinese: 汽車司機會意地咧嘴一笑，向我豎起大拇指。

sentences.english: He winced as she stood on his injured foot .
sentences.chinese: 她踩着他受傷的腳，他疼得齜牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: As he clambered over the railings he grinned at Manuel.
sentences.chinese: 在他攀爬翻過圍欄時他對曼紐爾咧嘴笑了笑。
她咧嘴笑着，並揮手致意。

sentences.english: The animal bared its teeth in anger.
sentences.chinese: 那頭動物憤怒得呲牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: I grin, quite pleased by this turn of events.
sentences.chinese: 我咧嘴笑了笑，對事情的轉變感到很高興。

sentences.english: The dog grinned at the stranger.
Jeremy grinned as he sipped his last sip of milk.
sentences.chinese: 傑瑞米喝完最後一滴牛奶，咧嘴一笑。

sentences.english: The grin is a grin for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 咧嘴一笑是笑給照相機鏡頭的。

sentences.english: Seldom had this demon ever relaxed into a grin.
sentences.chinese: 這個魔鬼很少放鬆咧嘴大笑。

sentences.english: I remember you, too, he grinned .
sentences.chinese: 我也記得你，他咧嘴一笑。

sentences.english: We spent the rest of the morning helping Dan prepare for the meeting. He even cracked a smile.
sentences.chinese: 用了整個上午幫着丹爲會議做，他甚至咧嘴笑了。

definition: to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
to draw back the corners of one's mouth
to giggle/to laugh foolishly/to smirk/to simper
to put on a fake smile (idiom)/to smile insincerely
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
